titleStmt.title: A black-smith and no Jesuite or, a true relation how I VVilliam Houlbrook black-smith of Marleborough was betray'd by Cornet George Joyce, who carried the King prisoner from Holmby; and of the unjust imprisoning of me: and my several examination: before Bradshaw, and his bloody crew: with my answers unto all of them, as you may read in the following discourse. Written in the time of my imprisonment, and now put to publick view.
titleStmt.author: Houlbrook, William.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for the author, and are to be sould by Francis Lash, next door to the Pauls-head Tavern at Pauls-Chain,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
